title: David Cameron | Biography, Brexit, & Facts | Britannica

quotes: David Cameron ... served as prime minister of the United Kingdom (2010–16).
He attended Eton College and Brasenose College, Oxford, from which he graduated (1988) with a first-class degree in philosophy, politics, and economics.
In 1992 he became a special adviser to Norman Lamont, then chancellor of the Exchequer, and the following year he undertook the same role for Michael Howard, then home secretary.
Cameron joined the media company Carlton Communications in 1994 as director of corporate affairs.
He stayed at Carlton until he entered Parliament in 2001 as MP for Witney, northwest of London.

organizations.name: Conservative Party
quotes: David Cameron ... is a British Conservative Party leader who served as prime minister of the United Kingdom (2010–16).
After Oxford he joined the Conservative Party Research Department.
